result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Streib was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: All unpaid financial obligations in this matter are to be paid at the rate of $35 per month starting 2/28/17 and then $75 per month starting 10/31/17.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 60 days jail consecutive with Huber.    The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.

-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber consecutive.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  The Def. has 59 credit for days time served.
The Court also orders sex offender registration per Wis. Statutes 973.048 and 301.45; presents basis.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:56pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court with attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Defendant Brandon L Streib in custody.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments presented by Counsel. 

The Court orders:

Count #2
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber consecutive.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  The Def. has 59 credit for days time served. 

Count #3
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber consecutive.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

Count #4
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber consecutive.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

Count #5 - 
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber concurrent.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

Count #6
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber concurrent.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

Count #7
-  160 days Jefferson County commencing forthwith with Huber concurrent.  The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

All unpaid financial obligations in this matter are to be paid at the rate of $35 per month starting 2/28/17 and then $75 per month starting 10/31/17.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 60 days jail consecutive with Huber.    The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.  

The Court also orders sex offender registration per Wis. Statutes 973.048 and 301.45; presents basis. 
Recess 3:30pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Clerk's Note:  After verifying with the Court reporter, $341.76 in restitution was ordered on case 13CM566 and $0 restitution was ordered as to case 15CF332
from Attorney De La Rosa requesting JOCs in 15CF332 & 13CM566 be corrected

Cases 15CF332 & 13CM566 called together at 2:34 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock informs the Court that parties have an agreement on restitution:
- Case 15CF332 the amount shall be set at $341.76
- Case 13CM566 the amount shall be $0

Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that they do have victim rights compliance, amounts had been submitted, but no supporting documents. Parties were aware of today's date and no one appears.
Court orders
Recess: 2:37 pm

NEXT: Clerk to amend Judgments to reflect restitution
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Cases 15CM506, 13CM566, and 15CF332 called together at 9:42am 
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to 15CM506 (Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

As to Case 13CM566(Sentencing Occurs):
As to Cases 15CM506 and 15CF332 (Plea/Sentencing occurs):

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, and #7 of Case 15CF332 of the Information and Case 15CM506 ; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; submits to the Court victim impact statements
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CF332

Sentencing arguements given by Counsel
--ADA Teuber requests 60 days to submit final restitution amounts

As to Case 13CM566:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-- On Count #1: to serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--On Count #2: to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served concurrent with Count #1
--10 days credit for time already served given
--On Count #1: pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 
--On Count #2: pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 
--Restitution in an amount to be determined payable to the parents of JRA (to be coverted to Civil Judgement)


As to Case 15CM506:
The Court sentences the Defendant to:
Serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in case 13CM566
--On Count #1: pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Streib is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.


As to Case 15CF332:
On Counts #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, and #7, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
-- to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit a DNA sample upon demand
--No Contact with JRA (dob:3/8/2000) or DJAR (dob:4/14/1998)
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #6: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #7: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution to the parents of JRA in an amount to be determined
As to Case 15CF332: Days credit for time already served:  0  days


The Total Costs/Fee of Cases 13CM566 and 15CM506 are to be coverted to Civil Judgement. 
recess 10:16am

NEXT: Restitution Hearing on 2/11/16 at 2:30pm (allow 1 hour)

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Steib waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. De La Rosa requests that this file be scheduled with Mr. Streib's pending misdemeanor case
--The Court directs the Clerk to do so. 
recess: 9:10am

NEXT:   Status Conference on 12/17/15 at 9:00am
Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Cases 13CM566 & 15CF332 called together at pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that parties will not be able to resolve matters today, so will treat matters as return on warrant.
Court reviews case file documents, indicates warrants were issued when the Defendant failed to appear at last scheduled hearing - Mr. Streib was given notice in person
Atty De La Rosa presents basis for non-appearance for the Court; decided to hear matter today at 2:30 for voluntary appearance, but was arrested today on warrants
Bond arguments by Counsel; Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they will not be contesting revocation of DPA 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty De La Rosa indicates they could move ahead with sentencing on CM case today
ADA Shock indicates that they do not have victim rights compliance to move ahead with sentencing today on CM case

Court requires a $2500 cash bond, to cover both files, with all non-monetary conditions as previously set in felony matter.
-No contact with JRA (3/8/2000)
-No presence at  930 S. County Trunk Hwy Y, Jefferson
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Booking at JCSD 

Court finds DPA has been violated; finds the defendant guilty and enters judgment
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty De La Rosa requests the CF matter be set for preliminary hearing in 10 days
Court cancels the bond forfeiture hearing scheduled in January
Recess: 2:47pm

NEXT: 15CF332 (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 12/11/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices  
13CM566 (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 12/17/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices

Cases 15CF332 and 13CM566 called at 1:44pm 
Defendant Brandon L Streib not in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock discloses that the State and the Court are aware of Attorney De La Rosa's inability to attend today's hearing, but indicates that Mr. Streib should be present in Court
ADA Shock requests that the Court take no action of the Motions at this time. 
ADA Shock motions for a bench warrant. 

The Court issues a bench warrant in each case, finds that bonds are in default and orders them forfeit. 
The Court does not take any action on the State's Motions at this time.
recess: 1:48pm

Cases 13CM566 & 15CF332 called together at 8:49 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brandon L Streib in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF332:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with JRA (3/8/2000)
-No presence at  930 S. County Trunk Hwy Y, Jefferson
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Booking at JCSD 

13CM566: Counsel agree motion shall be heard on 11/24/15 as Atty De La Rosa did not have notice
Recess: 8:53 am 

NEXT: 15CF332 (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 11/4/15 at 9:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 11/24/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notice
13CM566 (1) Motion (Motion for Entry of Judgments) 11/24/15 at 1:30 pm
